title: What to expect from Soccerway’s weekly betting guide
text:
What to expect from Soccerway’s weekly betting guide Getty Images 0 Feb 28, 2017 09:00:00 Are you a regular bettor looking for a helping hand with your weekend research? If so then Soccerway’s free betting guide could be the ideal companion 
After a successful pre-season Premier League version, Soccerway’s weekly betting guide has picked up a significant following with thousands of members now getting a free copy every week . 
The premise of the publication is simple, the team research the upcoming weekend matches in order to find picks which are both good value and backed up by the statistics available on site. It’s available on desktop, mobile or tablet, so you can take it with you wherever you are. 
Plenty of punters will already have their own methods of studying up in place and this publication is not designed to replace that, but it could another layer of valuable information to the process and it is regularly producing plenty of winners and has turned a level stakes profit on several occasions this term. 
The majority of the picks are single selections covering matches from all around the globe. We know that the Soccerway audience isn’t just a UK centric one, so, while there is still plenty of focus on the Premier League and Football League, the picks can come from a whole host of different competitions. Multiple backers might also want to check out the weekly five fold, which has already landed three times this season. 
As well as using the tools on site to examine form, head-to-head records, the times teams score their goals and much more, there’s also a look at the latest Opta facts which are another valuable source of information when preparing for a weekend of action. 
The team don’t stop when there’s no domestic action either. They turn their attentions to cup competitions and internationals to ensure that whatever the football landscape looks like, Soccerway members will have a range of expert advice to help. 
Does this sound like a resource that you would find useful or simply pique your interest and is something that you would like to take a look at? If so, you can join the thousands of other punters getting a free weekly copy delivered directly to their email inboxes. 
Simply register on site, it’s quick, simple and most importantly, free. Once you have done so you’ll be added to the weekly emails which go out as soon as the guide is available, usually on a Friday morning. That should give plenty of time to have a read of the analysis before deciding if you want to use any of the information to inform your bets. 
Want to see what the guide looks like before that? Simply head to your profile page on Soccerway and there is a link to download the latest edition whenever you like. Related
